Exaggerate: The claim falsely exaggerates the connection between donations made to the Black Lives Matter website and the Democratic National Committee (DNC).
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to back up the assertion that donations go directly to the DNC.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that using ActBlue Charities as a fundraising platform automatically means donations go directly to the DNC, which is a problematic assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert provides an alternative explanation by explaining that donations made on the Black Lives Matter website go to the Black Lives Matter Global Network Foundation, not directly to the DNC.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that donations made on the Black Lives Matter website do not go directly to the DNC but instead pass through a nonprofit that sponsors the group.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by distorting the facts regarding the nonprofit ActBlue and its relationship with the Democratic campaigns and organizations.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in the provided claim.
